Frequently Asked Questions - General

Who, What, When, Where, Why?
Is Drupalcamp Chicago a good event for newbies?

Absolutely! We have a special Beginner’s track for those who are just familiarizing themselves with Drupal.

How do I pay?

Credit cards and various forms of payment are accepted via PayPal during our secure online registration. If you need to pay by check or cash, contact us.

How much does Drupalcamp Chicago cost?

$40+online transaction fees.

How many people are you expecting?

About 300 attendees.

When and where is Drupalcamp Chicago this year?

When:Saturday December 10th 9:00am-5:00pm
Where: One North Wacker Drive "UBS Tower Conference Center", Chicago, IL.

Will Drupalcamp Chicago Rock?

Yes.

About Drupal
What can I expect?

Friendly people. Meet new friends. Learn about Drupal and various open source technologies. Watch various presentations running in multiple rooms. Or participate in a discussion in a BoF (Birds of a Feather).

Who uses Drupal?

Locally:

  • The Field Museum
  • Northwestern University

Nationally:

  • The Whitehouse
  • The US House of Representatives - in 2011 launched 520 Drupal sites, one for each representative.
  • US Chamber of Commerce
  • The Cable News Network (CNN)
  • Greenpeace uses Drupal
  • Cartoon Network
  • RackSpace (major web hosting provider)

Internationally:

  • Amnesty International uses Drupal
What is Drupal?

Drupal is a mature, open-source, PHP-based CMS and web application framework. Find out more at http://drupal.org.

What is a Drupalcamp?

Drupal is a free open-source content management system (CMS) written in the PHP programming language. Drupalcamps are community sharing + training events for Drupal enthusiasts and newbies alike. A camp is a full day of presentations and learning. Arrive at about 9:00am and learn all day.

Registration
What if I signed up, but now have a conflict?

Contact us and we will work something out – freeing up your seat may provide an opportunity for someone else.

Will I receive any registration materials in the mail?

We’ll send you a few emails leading up to the camp, but that’s it. Keep an eye out for the emails.

How do I register?

You register here

Help
How can I help?

We are glad you asked! We need a lot of volunteer assistance to help with shooting session videos, picture taking, registration, clean-up, etc. on the day of the event. Please register to volunteer and we will get in touch with you.

Can I still become a sponsor of Drupalcamp Chicago?

Yes, please fill out our sponsorship form.

Before & After
What do I need to bring?
We recommend bringing a laptop and lots of business cards. We will feed you well and dress comfortably. If you have a mobile broadband card, bring it, Internet bandwidth is always scarce at major nerd events. If you have a "Clear wifi access point", please bring that as well for additional bandwidth. We are also in need of extra video recording equipment to record session, if you have great let us know!
